title: ICE / KIM RACISM FINAL TALK
description: You failed the red check to get Kim to dance, and now you have to try to make amends or lose Kim's friendship forever.

dialogueTree.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "It's colder outside than you were e..."
dialogueTree.english: It's colder outside than you were expecting. You see the lieutenant, standing there, a small cloud of white escaping from his mouth...
dialogueTree.polish: Na zewnątrz jest zimniej, niż się spodziewałeś. Widzisz porucznika stojącego w białym obłoku wydobywającego się z jego ust...
dialogueTree.belarusian: Звонку халадней, чым ты чакаў. Ты бачыш лейтэнанта, які стаіць у белым воблаку, што вырываецца з яго рота...

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "He turns to you, but says nothing."
links.english: He turns to you, but says nothing.
links.polish: Odwraca się do ciebie, ale milczy.
links.belarusian: Паварочваецца да цябе, але маўчыць.

links.title: Empathy: "He's waiting to see what you do. Fo..."
links.english: He's waiting to see what you do. For god's sake say you fucked up, please.
links.polish: Czeka, żeby zobaczyć, co zrobisz. Na litość boską, powiedz, że zjebałeś. Proszę.
links.belarusian: Чакае, каб убачыць, што ты зробіш. Дзеля Бога, скажы, што ты нарабіў. Калі ласка.

links.title: Volition: "First the investigation, now this....."
links.english: First the investigation, now this... how many more things do you have to fuck up?
links.polish: Najpierw śledztwo, teraz to... Ile jeszcze rzeczy musisz zjebać?
links.belarusian: Спачатку расследаванне, цяпер гэта... Колькі яшчэ рэчаў ты павінен сапсаваць?

links.title: Pain Threshold: "Sharp pain shoots through your hip,..."
links.english: Sharp pain shoots through your hip, throbbing...
links.polish: Przez biodro przebiega ci błyskawica ostrego, pulsującego bólu...
links.belarusian: Праз сцягно прабягае табе маланка вострага, пульсуючага болю...

links.title: You: ""Hey, Kim.""
links.english: "Hey, Kim."
links.polish: „Hej, Kim”.
links.belarusian: "Гэй, Кім".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Detective," he says, his voice lev..."
links.english: "Detective," he says, his voice level as a tabletop.
links.polish: „Detektywie” – odpowiada głosem płaskim jak stół.
links.belarusian: "Дэтэктыве", — адказвае голасам плоскім, як стол.

links.title: Composure: "There won't be any preamble chit-ch..."
links.english: There won't be any preamble chit-chat this time. Get to the point.
links.polish: Tym razem nie będzie żadnej wstępnej dyskusji. Przejdź do rzeczy.
links.belarusian: На гэты раз не будзе ніякай папярэдняй дыскусіі. Пераходзь да справы.

links.title: You: ""What's your problem?""
links.english: "What's your problem?"
links.polish: „A tobie o co chodzi?”
links.belarusian: "А табе чаго трэба?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""What's *my* problem?" he says, his..."
links.english: "What's *my* problem?" he says, his voice rising with indignation...
links.polish: „O co *mi* chodzi?” – odpowiada pytaniem, a w jego głosie słychać narastające wzburzenie...
links.belarusian: "Пра што *мне* ідзе гаворка?" – адказвае пытаннем, і ў яго голасе чуваць нарастальнае ўстрывожанне...

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You're a real piece of work, detec..."
links.english: "You're a real piece of work, detective, you know that?"
links.polish: „Kawał z ciebie drania, detektywie, wiesz?”
links.belarusian: "Вялікі ты падлюга, дэтэктыў, ведаеш?"

Alternate1.english: "You're a real piece of work, Harry, you know that?"

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "He is your half-brother and you're..."
links.english: He is your half-brother and you're driving him away. For what?
links.polish: To twój przyrodni brat, a ty go tak traktujesz. I za co?
links.belarusian: Гэта твой зводны брат, а ты яго так трактуеш. І за што?

links.title: You: ""What do you want me to do?""
links.english: "What do you want me to do?"
links.polish: „Co chcesz, żebym zrobił?”
links.belarusian: "Што ты хочаш, каб я зрабіў?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""*Apologizing* would be a good star..."
links.english: "*Apologizing* would be a good start."
links.polish: „Na początek mógłbyś *przeprosić*”.
links.belarusian: "Спачатку ты мог бы *папрасіць прабачэння*".

links.title: You: ""I don't see why you're getting all..."
links.english: "I don't see why you're getting all bent out of shape over a *word*."
links.polish: „Nie rozumiem, czemu aż tak się irytujesz przez głupie *słowo*”.
links.belarusian: "Я не разумею, чаму ты так злуеш з-за дурнога *слова*".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant sighs. "Maybe it rea..."
links.english: The lieutenant sighs. "Maybe it really *isn't* your fault. You might just be an irretrievable human catastrophe..."
links.polish: Porucznik wzdycha. „Może to rzeczywiście *nie jest* twoja wina. Może jesteś po prostu beznadziejną ludzką katastrofą...”
links.belarusian: Лейтэнант уздыхнуў. "Магчыма, сапраўды *гэта не* твая віна. Магчыма, ты проста безнадзейная чалавечая катастрофа..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Which I guess makes *me* the idiot..."
links.english: "Which I guess makes *me* the idiot for hoping you could be better... I mean, *look* at yourself..."
links.polish: „Co czyniłoby *mnie* kretynem, który ma nadzieję, że możesz zmienić się na lepsze... *Spójrz* tylko na siebie...”
links.belarusian: "Што зрабіла б *мяне* ідыётам, які спадзяецца, што ты можаш змяніцца да лепшага... *Паглядзі* толькі на сябе..."

links.title: Volition: "Yes, look at yourself. What do you..."
links.english: Yes, look at yourself. What do you see?
links.polish: Tak. Popatrz na siebie. Co widzisz?
links.belarusian: Так. Паглядзі на сябе. Што бачыш?

links.title: You: "'Irretrievable human catastrophe' s..."
links.english: 'Irretrievable human catastrophe' sounds about right.
links.polish: „Beznadziejna ludzka katastrofa” brzmi mniej więcej właściwie.
links.belarusian: "Безнадзейная чалавечая катастрофа" гучыць прыкладна правільна.

links.title: Volition: "So that's it? You don't even *want*..."
links.english: So that's it? You don't even *want* to change?
links.polish: A więc to tak? Nawet *nie chcesz* się zmienić?
links.belarusian: Дык вось як? Нават *не хочаш* змяніцца?

links.title: You: "A good guy, underneath it all."
links.english: A good guy, underneath it all.
links.polish: Pod tą wierzchnią warstwą? Dobrego chłopaka.
links.belarusian: Пад гэтай верхняй пленкай? Добрага хлопца.

links.title: Volition: "If that good guy never comes out, w..."
links.english: If that good guy never comes out, what difference does it make?
links.polish: Skoro ten dobry chłopak pozostaje wciąż w środku, to co on właściwie zmienia?
links.belarusian: Калі гэты добры хлопец па-ранейшаму застаецца ўнутры, то што ён на самай справе змяняе?

links.title: You: "A goddamn superstar, that's what."
links.english: A goddamn superstar, that's what.
links.polish: Cholerną supergwiazdę, ot co.
links.belarusian: Чортаву суперзорку, во што.

links.title: Volition: "Kind of hard to sing a duet when yo..."
links.english: Kind of hard to sing a duet when you're all alone on-stage, isn't it, superstar?
links.polish: Trochę trudno śpiewać w duecie, kiedy na scenie jesteś sam, co, supergwiazdo?
links.belarusian: Трошкі цяжка спяваць у дуэце, калі на сцэне ты адзін, што, суперзорка?

links.title: You: "The harbinger of doom."
links.english: The harbinger of doom.
links.polish: Herolda zniszczenia.
links.belarusian: Геральд разбурэння.

links.title: Volition: "The only doom you've brought about..."
links.english: The only doom you've brought about so far is your own.
links.polish: Jedyne zniszczenie, jakie dotąd skutecznie obwieściłeś, to twój własny upadek.
links.belarusian: Адзінае знішчэнне, якое да гэтага часу паспяхова абвясціў, гэта тваё ўласнае падзенне.

links.title: You: "Just a sorry stack of shit..."
links.english: Just a sorry stack of shit...
links.polish: Zwykłą żałosną kupę gówna...
links.belarusian: Звычайная жаласная куча г...

links.title: Volition: "Yeah, didn't even know they stack s..."
links.english: Yeah, didn't even know they stack shit *that* sorry.
links.polish: Tak, nie przyszło mi nawet do głowy, że istnieją kupy *aż tak* żałosnego gówna.
links.belarusian: Так, мне нават не прыйшло ў галаву, што існуюць кучы *настолькі* жаласнага лайна.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I just don't understand. We had be..."
links.english: "I just don't understand. We had been making *real* progress toward solving the case..."
links.polish: „Po prostu nie rozumiem. Robiliśmy *prawdziwe* postępy w rozwiązywaniu tej sprawy...”
links.belarusian: "Проста не разумею. Мы рабілі *сапраўдны* прагрэс у вырашэнні гэтай справы..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""But now I'm afraid I just can't tr..."
links.english: "But now I'm afraid I just can't trust you."
links.polish: „Ale teraz obawiam się, że po prostu nie mogę ci ufać”.
links.belarusian: "Але цяпер баюся, што проста не магу табе давяраць".

links.title: You: ""Okay, I know you're mad, but I act..."
links.english: "Okay, I know you're mad, but I actually just talked to the spirit of Revachol and she told me we need to work together..."
links.polish: „No dobrze, wiem, że jesteś zły, ale rozmawiałem właśnie z duszą Revacholu. Powiedziała mi, że musimy współpracować...”
links.belarusian: "Ну добра, я ведаю, што ты злы, але я толькі што размаўляў з душой Рэвашолю. Яна сказала мне, што мы павінны супрацоўнічаць..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant looks at you with a..."
links.english: The lieutenant looks at you with a mix of pity, contempt, and alarm...
links.polish: Porucznik spogląda na ciebie z politowaniem, pogardą i niepokojem...
links.belarusian: Лейтэнант глядзіць на цябе з жалем, пагардай і неспакоем...

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Get your shit together, detective.""
links.english: "Get your shit together, detective."
links.polish: „Weź się w garść, detektywie”.
links.belarusian: "Вазьмі сябе ў рукі, дэтэктыве".

links.title: You: ""But Kim, the spirit...""
links.english: "But Kim, the spirit..."
links.polish: „Ale Kim, ta dusza...”
links.belarusian: "Але Кім, тая душа..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Detective, enough. I don't want to..."
links.english: "Detective, enough. I don't want to hear about your degenerate ravings. I've heard *plenty* as it is. Just stop."
links.polish: „Dość tego, detektywie. Nie chcę więcej wysłuchiwać twojego zdegenerowanego bredzenia. Nasłuchałem się już go *ponad miarę*. Po prostu przestań”.
links.belarusian: "Досыць гэтага, дэтэктыве. Я не хачу больш слухаць тваёй выраджанай балбатні. Наслухаўся ўжо яе *звыш меры*. Проста спыніся".

links.title: You: ""I'm working on it, I just need you..."
links.english: "I'm working on it, I just need your help..."
links.polish: „Pracuję nad tym, ale potrzebuję twojej pomocy...”
links.belarusian: "Я працую над гэтым, але мне патрэбна твая дапамога..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""God, *no*. I'm a detective, not a..."
links.english: "God, *no*. I'm a detective, not a charity service for shambolic degenerates who won't help themselves..."
links.polish: „Boże, *nie*. Jestem detektywem, a nie instytucją charytatywną zajmującą się chaotycznymi degeneratami, którzy nie są w stanie pomóc sobie sami...”
links.belarusian: "Божа, *не*. Я дэтэктыў, а не дабрачынная арганізацыя, якая займаецца хаатычнымі дэгенератамі, што не здольныя дапамагчы сабе самі..."

links.title: You: ""Kim, I can explain...""
links.english: "Kim, I can explain..."
links.polish: „Kim, mogę wyjaśnić...”
links.belarusian: "Кім, я магу растлумачыць..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Stop, STOP. You won't even call me..."
links.english: "Stop, STOP. You won't even call me by my *actual title*. It's always, 'Kim this, Kim that.' Has it even occurred to you how disrespectful that is?"
links.polish: „Przestań, PRZESTAŃ! Nie zwracasz się nawet do mnie, stosując mój *służbowy stopień*. Ciągle tylko Kim to, Kim tamto. Czy zdajesz sobie w ogóle sprawę z tego, jak bardzo jest to lekceważące i obraźliwe?”
links.belarusian: "Спыніся, СПЫНІСЯ! Ты нават не звяртаешся да мяне, выкарыстоўваючы мой *службовы ранг*. Ты ўвесь час толькі Кім гэта, Кім тое. Ці ўсведамляеш ты наогул, наколькі гэта пагардліва і абразліва?"

links.title: You: ""But what about all the good times..."
links.english: "But what about all the good times we had together?"
links.polish: „Ale co z dobrymi wspomnieniami, jakie nas łączą?”
links.belarusian: "Але што з добрымі ўспамінамі, якія нас злучаюць?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""*What* good times?""
links.english: "*What* good times?"
links.polish: „*Jakimi* wspomnieniami?”
links.belarusian: "*Якімі* ўспамінамі?"

links.title: You: ""It was just words, Kim. They don't..."
links.english: "It was just words, Kim. They don't mean anything."
links.polish: „To były tylko słowa, Kim. One nic nie znaczą”.
links.belarusian: "Гэта былі ўсяго толькі словы, Кім. Яны нічога не значаць".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""If they don't mean anything, why d..."
links.english: "If they don't mean anything, why do you say them?"
links.polish: „Jeśli nic nie znaczą, to po co je wypowiadasz?”
links.belarusian: "Калі яны нічога не значаць, дык навошта іх вымаўляць?"

links.title: You: ""I can do better.""
links.english: "I can do better."
links.polish: „Stać mnie na więcej”.
links.belarusian: "Мяне хапае на больш".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""But, see, you *can't*, or you just..."
links.english: "But, see, you *can't*, or you just refuse to, not that the difference really matters."
links.polish: „Problem w tym, że *nie możesz* albo po prostu nie chcesz się zmienić. Chociaż i tak nie ma to żadnego znaczenia”.
links.belarusian: "Праблема ў тым, што *ты не можаш* альбо проста не хочаш змяніцца. Хоць усё роўна гэта не мае ніякага значэння".

links.title: You: ""So... what now?" (Proceed.)"
links.english: "So... what now?" (Proceed.)
links.polish: „To... co teraz?” (Przejdź dalej).
links.belarusian: "Дык... што цяпер?" (Ідзі далей).

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant goes silent for a mo..."
links.english: The lieutenant goes silent for a moment.
links.polish: Porucznik milknie na chwilę.
links.belarusian: Лейтэнант змоўк на момант.

links.title: Composure: "He has the upright bearing of a kin..."
links.english: He has the upright bearing of a king's headsman, waiting to carry out the crown's sentence.
links.polish: Trzyma się prosto niczym królewski kat czekający na sygnał wykonania wyroku.
links.belarusian: Стаіць прама, як каралеўскі кат, які чакае сігналу для выканання прысуду.

links.title: Empathy: "He's been anticipating this moment..."
links.english: He's been anticipating this moment for some time. Still, it doesn't make it any easier for him to say...
links.polish: Spodziewał się już od dłuższego czasu, że ten moment nadejdzie. A jednak wcale mu nie jest przez to łatwiej powiedzieć...
links.belarusian: Ён ужо даўно чакаў, што гэты момант надыдзе. Але нягледзячы на гэта, яму не становіцца лягчэй сказаць...

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""For the sake of the investigation...."
links.english: "For the sake of the investigation... I'll stay."
links.polish: „Dla dobra śledztwa... zostanę”.
links.belarusian: "Для дабра расследавання... застануся".

links.title: Inland Empire: "You hear that? The lieutenant's sta..."
links.english: You hear that? The lieutenant's staying! Brotherhood conquers all!
links.polish: Słyszysz? Porucznik zostaje z tobą! Braterstwo zwycięża wszystko!
links.belarusian: Чуеш? Лейтэнант застаецца з табой! Брацтва перамагае ўсё!

links.title: You: ""So, you're giving me another shot?""
links.english: "So, you're giving me another shot?"
links.polish: „A więc dajesz mi kolejną szansę?”
links.belarusian: "Дык ты даеш мне яшчэ адзін шанец?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No, you fucking asshole. This isn'..."
links.english: "No, you fucking asshole. This isn't a *game* and you're not the *hero*. You don't *get* infinite chances to do the right thing. That's not how the world works..."
links.polish: „Nie, pieprzony dupki. To nie jest *gra*, a ty nie jesteś *bohaterem*. Nie *masz* nieskończonej liczby szans, aby postąpić właściwie. Świat tak nie działa...”
links.belarusian: "Не, халеры вы такія. Гэта не *гульня*, і ты не *герой*. У цябе няма *бясконцай* колькасці шанцаў, каб паступіць правільна. Свет так не працуе..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I'm staying because *I* have to pr..."
links.english: "I'm staying because *I* have to protect the investigation *from you*..."
links.polish: „Zostaję, bo *muszę* chronić to śledztwo *przed tobą*...”
links.belarusian: "Застаюся, бо *павінен* абараніць гэтае расследаванне *ад цябе*..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Now -- if it were any other day, I..."
links.english: "Now -- if it were any other day, I would excuse myself for the night. But we have more pressing matters. We need to get to the island -- and we need to do it as soon as possible."
links.polish: „Gdyby to był inny dzień, pożegnałbym się teraz i udał na nocny spoczynek. Ale mamy ważniejsze sprawy na głowie. Musimy dostać się na wyspę – i musimy zrobić to jak najszybciej”.
links.belarusian: "Калі б гэта быў іншы дзень, я б цяпер развітаўся і адправіўся на начны адпачынак. Але ў нас ёсць больш важныя справы. Мы павінны патрапіць на востраў — і мы павінны зрабіць гэта як мага хутчэй".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""This case," he turns to face the s..."
links.english: "This case," he turns to face the sea, "is much, *much* bigger than just you or me. We're close to the end -- let's cross the finish line. Then we can part our ways."
links.polish: „Ta sprawa” – odwraca się w kierunku morza – „jest znacznie, *znacznie* ważniejsza od ciebie czy mnie. Zbliżamy się do jej końca, więc dotrzyjmy razem do mety. Wtedy będziemy mogli się rozejść na dobre”.
links.belarusian: "Гэтая справа," — паварочваецца ў напрамку мора, — "значна, *значна* важнейшая за цябе ці мяне. Мы блізкія да яе завяршэння, таму давайце разам дасягнем фінішу. Тады мы зможам разысціся назаўжды".

links.title: Shivers: "The dark shadow of the church is dr..."
links.english: The dark shadow of the church is drawn out on the sand... two men stand there, silent. Their talk is over.
links.polish: Mroczny cień kościoła pada na okoliczny piach... W jego objęciach stoi dwóch milczących mężczyzn. Ich rozmowa dobiegła końca.
links.belarusian: Цёмны цень царквы падае на акаляючы пясок... У яе абдымках стаяць два маўклівыя мужчыны. Іх размова скончылася.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Now -- if it were any other day, I..."
links.english: "Now -- if it were any other day, I would excuse myself for the night. But we have more pressing matters. We need to wrap up this investigation and we need to do it *fast*."
links.polish: „Gdyby to był inny dzień, pożegnałbym się teraz i udał na nocny spoczynek. Ale mamy ważniejsze sprawy na głowie. Musimy zakończyć to śledztwo i to *szybko*”.
links.belarusian: "Калі б гэта быў іншы дзень, я б зараз развітаўся і пайшоў на начны адпачынак. Але ў нас больш важныя справы на думцы. Мы павінны завяршыць гэта расследаванне і гэта *хутка*".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Now, if you'll excuse me, I have s..."
links.english: "Now, if you'll excuse me, I have some other matters to attend to. We'll meet again as usual in the morning. And detective..."
links.polish: „A teraz wybacz, ale mam coś do zrobienia. Spotkamy się ponownie tak jak zwykle rano. I, detektywie...”
links.belarusian: "А цяпер даруй, але ў мяне ёсць справы. Пабачымся зноў, як звычайна, раніцай. І, дэтэктыве..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Don't fuck anything else up while..."
links.english: "Don't fuck anything else up while I'm away."
links.polish: „Nie spieprz niczego więcej, gdy mnie nie będzie”.
links.belarusian: "Не сапсуй нічога больш, калі мяне не будзе".

links.title: Authority: "The sentence has been passed."
links.english: The sentence has been passed.
links.polish: Wyrok został wydany.
links.belarusian: Прысуд вынесены.

links.title: Shivers: "The dark shadow of the church is dr..."
links.english: The dark shadow of the church is drawn out on the sand... two men stand there, silent. Their talk is over.
links.polish: Mroczny cień kościoła pada na okoliczny piach... W jego objęciach stoi dwóch milczących mężczyzn. Ich rozmowa dobiegła końca.
links.belarusian: Цёмны цень касцёла падае на навакольны пясок... У яго абдымках стаяць двое маўклівых мужчын. Іх размова скончылася.

links.title: You: ""That's great, I could still use yo..."
links.english: "That's great, I could still use your assistance."
links.polish: „To wspaniale, nadal potrzebna mi twoja pomoc”.
links.belarusian: "Гэта цудоўна, я ўсё яшчэ маю патрэбу ў тваёй дапамозе".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You fucking asshole. I'm not here..."
links.english: "You fucking asshole. I'm not here to be your *loyal assistant*, and I never have been..."
links.polish: „Ty pieprzony dupku. Nie jestem twoim *lojalnym pomocnikiem* i nigdy nim nie byłem...”
links.belarusian: "Ты грэбаны падонку. Я не твой *лояльны памочнік* і ніколі ім не быў..."

links.title: You: ""Why? I don't really need you anywa..."
links.english: "Why? I don't really need you anyway."
links.polish: „Ale czemu? I tak nie jesteś mi potrzebny”.
links.belarusian: "Але чаму? І так ты мне не патрэбны".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Of course that's what you think, c..."
links.english: "Of course that's what you think, contrary to all evidence and experience. I'm not here for your sake..."
links.polish: „Oczywiście, że tak myślisz – wbrew wszystkiemu, co się wydarzyło. Nie jestem tu z twojego powodu...”
links.belarusian: "Вядома, што ты так думаеш — нягледзячы на ўсё, што адбылося. Я не тут дзеля цябе..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You've been spinning your wheels h..."
links.english: "You've been spinning your wheels here for *how* long? And what do you have to show for it?"
links.polish: „*Ile* już czasu spędziłeś na tym błąkaniu się po omacku? I co z tego wynikło?”
links.belarusian: "Колькі часу ты ўжо правёў у гэтым блуканні пацемках? І што з гэтага выйшла?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Well, I'm done waiting for you to..."
links.english: "Well, I'm done waiting for you to get your shit together."
links.polish: „Dość już mam czekania, aż weźmiesz się w garść”.
links.belarusian: "Хопіць ужо чакаць, пакуль ты возьмеш сябе ў рукі".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You've not just been *unhelpful* w..."
links.english: "You've not just been *unhelpful* when it comes to solving the case, you've been an active *hindrance* to the investigation..."
links.polish: „Nie tylko *nie pomagałeś* w rozwiązywaniu tej sprawy, ale aktywnie *przeszkadzałeś* w śledztwie...”
links.belarusian: "Не толькі *не дапамог* у вырашэнні гэтай справы, але актыўна *перашкаджаў* у расследаванні..."

links.title: You: ""Okay, you're right. I fucked up ba..."
links.english: "Okay, you're right. I fucked up back there."
links.polish: „No dobra, masz rację. Zjebałem sprawę”.
links.belarusian: "Ну добра, ты маеш рацыю. Я сапсуў справу".

links.title: You: ""I think I fucked up back there...""
links.english: "I think I fucked up back there..."
links.polish: „Chyba zjebałem...”
links.belarusian: "Напэўна, я напартачыў..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You *think*?""
links.english: "You *think*?"
links.polish: „*Chyba*?”
links.belarusian: "Мабыць?"

links.title: You: ""Hey, I made a mistake, but it's no..."
links.english: "Hey, I made a mistake, but it's not all my fault, you know."
links.polish: „Hej, popełniłem błąd, ale wiesz, to nie wszystko moja wina”.
links.belarusian: "Гэй, я зрабіў памылку, але ведаеш, гэта не ўсё мая віна".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Really? It's not your *fault* that..."
links.english: "Really? It's not your *fault* that you're *down with racism* or whatever you told that lorryman?"
links.polish: „Poważnie? To nie twoja *wina*, że *rasizm ci pasuje*, czy co tak powiedziałeś temu kierowcy ciężarówki?”
links.belarusian: "Сур'ёзна? Гэта не твая *віна*, што табе *падыходзіць расізм*, ці што ты сказаў гэтаму дальнабойшчыку?"

links.title: Rhetoric: "You definitely could have handled t..."
links.english: You definitely could have handled that better.
links.polish: Zdecydowanie mogłeś załatwić to lepiej.
links.belarusian: Вызначана ты мог уладзіць гэта лепш.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It's not your *fault* that you sub..."
links.english: "It's not your *fault* that you subscribed to Measurehead's inane racial theories?"
links.polish: „To nie twoja *wina*, że poparłeś szalone rasistowskie teorie Miarogłowego?”
links.belarusian: "Гэта не твая віна, што ты падтрымаў вар'яцкія расісцкія тэорыі Міяроглавага?"

links.title: Conceptualization: "Those theories didn't really hold u..."
links.english: Those theories didn't really hold up in retrospect, did they?
links.polish: Te teorie, jak teraz na to spojrzeć, nie do końca się sprawdziły, nieprawdaż?
links.belarusian: Гэтыя тэорыі, калі зараз паглядзець на гэта, не цалкам спраўдзіліся, ці не праўда?

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It's not your *fault* that you buy..."
links.english: "It's not your *fault* that you buy into whatever conspiracies bug-chasing cryptofascists feed you?"
links.polish: „To nie twoja *wina*, że wierzysz w konspiracyjne teorie, którymi karmią cię polujący na robactwo kryptofaszyści?”
links.belarusian: "Гэта не твая віна, што ты верыш у змоўніцкія тэорыі, якімі кармілі цябе паляўнічыя на казуркі крыптафашысты?"

links.title: Logic: "He's right. No one *forced* you to..."
links.english: He's right. No one *forced* you to believe that nonsense.
links.polish: Ma rację. Nikt cię nie *zmuszał* do wiary w te bzdury.
links.belarusian: Ён мае рацыю. Ніхто цябе не *прымушаў* верыць у гэты лухту.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You know, detective, one of your p..."
links.english: "You know, detective, one of your problems is that *nothing* ever seems to be your fault. Have you noticed that?"
links.polish: „Wiesz, detektywie, jednym z twoich problemów jest to, że *nic* nigdy nie jest twoją winą. Zauważyłeś to?”
links.belarusian: "Ведаеш, дэтэктыў, адной з тваіх праблем з'яўляецца тое, што *нічога* ніколі не з'яўляецца тваёй віной. Ты гэта заўважыў?"

Alternate1.english: "You know, Harry, one of your problems is that *nothing* ever seems to be your fault. Have you noticed that?"
Alternate1.polish: „Wiesz, Harry, jednym z twoich problemów jest to, że *nic* nigdy nie jest twoją winą. Zauważyłeś to?”
Alternate1.belarusian: «Ведаеш, Гары, адна з тваіх праблем у тым, што *нішто* ніколі не бывае тваёй віной. Ці заўважаў ты гэта?»

links.title: You: ""Okay, scratch that. I *definitely*..."
links.english: "Okay, scratch that. I *definitely* fucked up."
links.polish: „Dobra, inaczej. *Zdecydowanie* zjebałem”.
links.belarusian: "Добра, інакш. *Адзначна* здаўбався".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes, and?""
links.english: "Yes, and?"
links.polish: „Tak – i?”
links.belarusian: "Так – і?"

links.title: You: ""'And'?""
Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant stares impassively."
links.english: The lieutenant stares impassively.
links.polish: Porucznik wpatruje się w ciebie beznamiętnie.
links.belarusian: Лейтэнант глядзіць на цябе безэмацыйна.

links.title: Shivers: "MAKE IT RIGHT. MORE THAN YOU KNOW D..."
links.english: MAKE IT RIGHT. MORE THAN YOU KNOW DEPENDS ON IT.
links.polish: NAPRAW TO. NA SZALI LEŻY WIĘCEJ, NIŻ SOBIE ZDAJESZ SPRAWĘ.
links.belarusian: ПАПРАЎ ГЭТА. НА КОНЕ ЛЕЖЫЦЬ БОЛЬШ, ЧЫМ ТЫ ЗДАТКА ПРАДСТАВІШ.

links.title: You: ""...and I'm sorry.""
links.english: "...and I'm sorry."
links.polish: „...i przepraszam”.
links.belarusian: "...і прашу прабачэння".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Let me ask you something..." He le..."
links.english: "Let me ask you something..." He leans in to inspect you.
links.polish: „Pozwól, że o coś cię zapytam...” – stwierdza, przysuwając się do ciebie, by lepiej ci się przyjrzeć.
links.belarusian: "Дазволь мне пра нешта цябе запытацца..." — кажа ён, набліжаючыся да цябе, каб лепш разгледзець цябе.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""What do you see when you look at m..."
links.english: "What do you see when you look at me?"
links.polish: „Kogo widzisz, gdy na mnie patrzysz?”
links.belarusian: "Каго ты бачыш, калі глядзіш на мяне?"

links.title: You: ""A true *Vacholiere*.""
links.english: "A true *Vacholiere*."
links.polish: „Prawdziwego *Vacholiere*”.
links.belarusian: "Сапраўднага *Vacholiere*".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant appears caught off-g..."
links.english: The lieutenant appears caught off-guard by your response. He takes a moment to collect himself...
links.polish: Porucznik sprawia wrażenie zaskoczonego twoją odpowiedzią. Potrzebuje chwili, by się pozbierać...
links.belarusian: Лейтэнант выглядае здзіўленым вашым адказам. Яму патрэбна хвіліна, каб сабрацца...

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Nobody's ever said that to me befo..."
links.english: "Nobody's ever said that to me before..."
links.polish: „Nikt nigdy mi tego jeszcze nie mówił...”
links.belarusian: "Ніхто ніколі мне гэтага яшчэ не казаў..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I don't suppose anyone ever questi..."
links.english: "I don't suppose anyone ever questions whether you belong here. Whatever your faults, you're a solid detective. You're *obviously* Revacholian..."
links.polish: „Nie sądzę, aby ktokolwiek kwestionował kiedykolwiek to, czy powinieneś tu być. Mimo swoich wad jesteś porządnym detektywem. Jesteś *bez wątpienia* revacholczykiem...”
links.belarusian: "Не думаю, што хтосьці калі-небудзь сумняваўся ў тым, ці павінен ты тут быць. Нягледзячы на свае недахопы, ты прыстойны дэтэктыў. Ты *без сумневу* рэвашолец..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I was born here. I grew up here. I..."
links.english: "I was born here. I grew up here. It's the only *home* I've ever known. And there's a good chance I'll die in the line of duty here, too."
links.polish: „Ja urodziłem się tu. Dorastałem tu. To jedyny *dom*, jaki znam. I istnieje duże prawdopodobieństwo tego, że zginę tu na służbie”.
links.belarusian: "Я нарадзіўся тут. Я вырас тут. Гэта адзіны *дом*, які я ведаю. І існуе вялікая верагоднасць таго, што я загіну тут на службе".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""But -- to most of my countrymen, I..."
links.english: "But -- to most of my countrymen, I will always be some *monkey fucker*."
links.polish: „Ale – dla większości moich ziomków – zawsze będę jakimś *małpojebcą*”.
links.belarusian: "Але — для большасці маіх зямлякоў — заўсёды буду нейкім *малпаёбцам*".

links.title: You: ""Wait, before I blacked out, I *tal..."
links.english: "Wait, before I blacked out, I *talked* to *La Revacholière*."
links.polish: „Czekaj. Zanim straciłem przytomność, *rozmawiałem* z *La Revacholière*”.
links.belarusian: "Чакай. Перад тым як знепритомнець, я *размаўляў* з *La Revacholière*".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You... what?""
links.english: "You... what?"
links.polish: „Co?”
links.belarusian: "Што?"

links.title: You: ""I spoke with the spirit of Revacho..."
links.english: "I spoke with the spirit of Revachol. Or, I guess, she spoke to *me*."
links.polish: „Rozmawiałem z duszą Revacholu. A właściwie to ona przemówiła *do mnie*”.
links.belarusian: "Я размаўляў з душой Рэвашолю. А дакладней, яна загаварыла *да мяне*".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Suppose I *don't* recommend you be..."
links.english: "Suppose I *don't* recommend you be involuntarily committed for a moment... what did *La Revacholière* say to you?"
links.polish: „Załóżmy przez chwilę, że *nie* zarekomenduję przymusowego umieszczenia cię w szpitalu psychiatrycznym... Co powiedziała ci ta *La Revacholière*?”
links.belarusian: "Дапусцім на хвіліну, што *не* рэкамендую прымусовага змяшчэння цябе ў псіхіятрычную бальніцу... Што сказала табе гэтая *La Revacholière*?"

Alternate1.english: "Suppose, for a moment, that this isn't just more of your *Remote Viewer* nonsense... what did *La Revacholière* say to you?"
Alternate1.polish: „Załóżmy przez chwilę, że to nie są kolejne bzdury związane z tym twoim *zdalnym widzeniem*... Co powiedziała ci ta *La Revacholière*?”
Alternate1.belarusian: «Падумаем на хвіліну, што гэта не чарговая лухта, звязаная з гэтым тваім *дистанцыйным бачаннем*... Што табе сказала гэтая *La Revacholière*?»

Alternate2.english: "Suppose, for a moment, that this isn't just a pyrholidon-induced hallucination... what did *La Revacholière* say to you?"
Alternate2.polish: „Załóżmy przez chwilę, że to nie były po prostu halucynacje wywołane pyrholidonem... Co powiedziała ci ta *La Revacholière*?”
Alternate2.belarusian: «Дапусцім на хвіліну, што гэта былі не проста галюцынацыі, выкліканыя пірхалідонам... Што сказала табе тая *La Revacholière*?»

Alternate3.english: "Suppose, for a moment, that this isn't more of your ghost-summoning nonsense... what did *La Revacholière* say to you?"
Alternate3.polish: „Załóżmy przez chwilę, że to nie są kolejne bzdury związane z tym twoim wywoływaniem duchów... Co powiedziała ci ta *La Revacholière*?”
Alternate3.belarusian: «Дапусцім на хвіліну, што гэта не чарговыя глупствы, звязаныя з тым тваім выкліканнем духаў... Што сказала табе гэтая *La Revacholière*?»

Alternate4.english: "Suppose, for a moment, that you're not just chasing urban legends again... what did *La Revacholière* say to you?"
Alternate4.polish: „Załóżmy przez chwilę, że nie uganiasz się znowu po prostu za miejskimi legendami... Co powiedziała ci ta *La Revacholière*?”
Alternate4.belarusian: «Дапусцім на імгненне, што ты зноўку не гнаешся проста за гарадскімі легендамі... Што сказала табе гэтая *La Revacholière*?»

links.title: Empathy: "Hold on a moment. Maybe now's not t..."
links.english: Hold on a moment. Maybe now's not the best time to tell the lieutenant that the world is ending...
links.polish: Poczekaj no. Może to nie jest najlepszy moment na opowiadanie porucznikowi o końcu świata...
links.belarusian: Пачакайце крыху. Можа, гэта не найлепшы момант, каб расказваць лейтэнанту пра канец свету...

links.title: You: ""Uh... she said the RCM is gonna ha..."
links.english: "Uh... she said the RCM is gonna have an important role to play..."
links.polish: „Eee... Powiedziała, że MOR będzie miał ważną rolę do odegrania...”
links.belarusian: "Эээ... Яна сказала, што РГМ будзе мець важную ролю ў выкананні..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""A role to play in *what*?""
links.english: "A role to play in *what*?"
links.polish: „Rolę do odegrania... w *czym*?”
links.belarusian: "Ролю выканаць... у *чым*?"

links.title: You: ""The... future?""
links.english: "The... future?"
links.polish: „W... przyszłości?”
links.belarusian: "У... будучыні?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""What kind of *future* are we talki..."
links.english: "What kind of *future* are we talking about here?"
links.polish: „O jakiej *przyszłości* mowa?”
links.belarusian: "Пра якую *будучыню* ідзе гаворка?"

links.title: You: ""You know... like stuff that hasn't..."
links.english: "You know... like stuff that hasn't happened yet."
links.polish: „No wiesz... O rzeczach, które się jeszcze nie wydarzyły”.
links.belarusian: "Ну ведаеш... Пра рэчы, якія яшчэ не адбыліся".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Quit fooling around, detective." T..."
links.english: "Quit fooling around, detective." There's real urgency in the lieutenant's voice now. "What did La Revacholière tell you about the future?"
links.polish: „Przestań się wygłupiać, detektywie” – w głosie porucznika słychać prawdziwe zniecierpliwienie. „Co La Revacholière powiedziała o przyszłości?”
links.belarusian: "Спыніце дурэць, дэтэктыў", – у голасе лейтэнанта чуваць сапраўднае нецярпенне. "Што сказала La Revacholière пра будучыню?"

links.title: You: ""She said the world is ending in 22..."
links.english: "She said the world is ending in 22 years."
links.polish: „Powiedziała, że świat skończy się za 22 lata”.
links.belarusian: "Яна сказала, што свет скончыцца праз 22 гады".

links.title: You: ""The end of the world.""
links.english: "The end of the world."
links.polish: „O końcu świata”.
links.belarusian: "Аб канцы свету".

links.title: You: ""The end of the world.""
links.english: "The end of the world."
links.polish: „W końcu świata”.
links.belarusian: "На краю свету".

links.title: You: ""She said the world is going to end..."
links.english: "She said the world is going to end in 22 years."
links.polish: „Powiedziała, że świat skończy się za 22 lata”.
links.belarusian: "Яна сказала, што свет скончыцца праз 22 гады".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""The world... is going to end..." T..."
links.english: "The world... is going to end..." The lieutenant considers this for a long moment...
links.polish: „Świat... się skończy...” – porucznik rozważa to przez chwilę.
links.belarusian: "Свет... скончыцца..." — лейтэнант разважае пра гэта некалькі імгненняў.

links.title: Empathy: "The lieutenant is a rational observ..."
links.english: The lieutenant is a rational observer of reality. His worldview can't accommodate this kind of thing.
links.polish: Porucznik racjonalnie ocenia rzeczywistość. Jego poglądy nie uwzględniają tego typu rzeczy.
links.belarusian: Лейтэнант рацыянальна ацэньвае рэчаіснасць. Яго погляды не ўлічваюць такога тыпу рэчаў.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Promise me something, detective: Y..."
links.english: "Promise me something, detective: You won't tell anyone else what you just told me."
links.polish: „Obiecaj mi coś, detektywie... Obiecaj, że nikomu więcej o tym nie powiesz”.
links.belarusian: "Абяцай мне адно, дэтэктыў... Абяцай, што нікому больш пра гэта не скажаш".

links.title: You: ""But Kim, I'm the Augur of Desolati..."
links.english: "But Kim, I'm the Augur of Desolation."
links.polish: „Ale Kim, ja jestem wyrocznią dewastacji”.
links.belarusian: "Але Кім, я з'яўляюся прарокам разбурэння".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Detective, I'm serious. Have you c..."
links.english: "Detective, I'm serious. Have you considered what will happen to the RCM's reputation if one of our own starts going around talking about the end of the world? In an official capacity?"
links.polish: „Detektywie, mówię poważnie. Pomyślałeś, co stanie się z reputacją MOR-u, gdy ktoś z naszych zacznie opowiadać wszystkim o zbliżającym się końcu świata? I to na służbie?”
links.belarusian: "Дэтэктыў, я кажу сур'ёзна. Ці падумаў ты, што будзе з рэпутацыяй РГМ, калі хтосьці з нашых пачне распавядаць усім пра набліжэнне канца свету? І гэта падчас службы?"

links.title: You: ""Are you sure? It seems kinda impor..."
links.english: "Are you sure? It seems kinda important."
links.polish: „Jesteś pewny? To się wydaje dość ważne”.
links.belarusian: "Ты ўпэўнены? Гэта здаецца даволі важным".

links.title: You: ""That's probably wise.""
links.english: "That's probably wise."
links.polish: „Tak pewnie będzie najlepiej”.
links.belarusian: "Так, пэўна, будзе найлепш".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Now, I... think I need to take car..."
links.english: "Now, I... think I need to take care of some personal matters for a while. If you don't object, I'm going to leave the rest of the day's investigation to you..."
links.polish: „A teraz... Zdaje się, że muszę zająć się pewnymi prywatnymi sprawami. Jeśli nie masz nic przeciwko, to do końca dnia pozostawię nasze śledztwo w twoich rękach...”
links.belarusian: "А цяпер... Здаецца, мне трэба заняцца пэўнымі прыватнымі справамі. Калі ты не супраць, то да канца дня пакіну нашае расследаванне ў тваіх руках..."

links.title: You: ""Go ahead.""
links.english: "Go ahead."
links.polish: „Dobrze”.
links.belarusian: "Добра".

links.title: You: ""Wait, I wasn't done...""
links.english: "Wait, I wasn't done..."
links.polish: „Poczekaj, jeszcze nie skończyłem...”
links.belarusian: "Пачакай, я яшчэ не скончыў..."

links.title: You: ""She said it was important that we..."
links.english: "She said it was important that we stick together, as partners."
links.polish: „Powiedziała, że to ważne, żebyśmy trzymali się razem. Jako partnerzy”.
links.belarusian: "Яна сказала, што важна, каб мы трымаліся разам. Як партнёры".

links.title: You: ""Never mind, I was just talking cra..."
links.english: "Never mind, I was just talking crazy talk."
links.polish: „Nieważne, gadam tylko bzdury”.
links.belarusian: "Не важна, я толькі вар"яцтва бяру."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I see..." the lieutenant says, tap..."
links.english: "I see..." the lieutenant says, tapping his foot...
links.polish: „Rozumiem...” – stwierdza porucznik, potupując stopą...
links.belarusian: "Разумею..." — зазначае лейтэнант, тупаючы нагой...

links.title: You: ""To me, you're my partner.""
links.english: "To me, you're my partner."
links.polish: „Dla mnie jesteś partnerem”.
links.belarusian: "Для мяне ты партнёр".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "For a moment the lieutenant seems t..."
links.english: For a moment the lieutenant seems to be suppressing something uncomfortable. Then he clears his throat...
links.polish: Przez chwilę porucznik zdaje się tłumić coś nieprzyjemnego. W końcu odchrząkuje...
links.belarusian: На хвіліну лейтэнант, здаецца, стрымлівае нешта непрыемнае. Нарэшце ён кашляе...

links.title: Composure: "The lieutenant's not comfortable wi..."
links.english: The lieutenant's not comfortable with emotional openness. He's eager to change the subject.
links.polish: Porucznik nie nawykł do emocjonalnej otwartości. Bardzo chętnie zmieni temat.
links.belarusian: Лейтэнант не прывык да эмацыянальнай адкрытасці. Ён з вялікай ахвотай зменіць тэму.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Now -- if it were any other day, I..."
links.english: "Now -- if it were any other day, I would leave for the night. But we have more pressing matters. We need to get to the island -- and we need to do it as soon as possible."
links.polish: „Gdyby to był inny dzień, udałbym się teraz na nocny spoczynek. Ale mamy ważniejsze sprawy na głowie. Musimy dostać się na wyspę – i musimy zrobić to jak najszybciej”.
links.belarusian: "Каб гэта быў іншы дзень, я б зараз адправіўся на начны адпачынак. Але ў нас ёсць больш важныя справы ў галаве. Нам трэба дабрацца да выспы — і мы павінны зрабіць гэта як мага хутчэй".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""This case," he turns to face the s..."
links.english: "This case," he turns to face the sea, "is much, *much* bigger than just you and me. We're close -- let's keep it professional until the very end."
links.polish: „Ta sprawa” – odwraca się w kierunku morza – „jest znacznie, *znacznie* ważniejsza od ciebie czy mnie. Prawie ją rozwiązaliśmy – zachowujmy się profesjonalnie do samego końca”.
links.belarusian: "Гэта справа" — паварочваецца ў кірунку мора — "значна, *значна* важнейшае за цябе ці мяне. Мы амаль яе вырашылі — давайце паводзіць сябе прафесійна да самага канца".

links.title: Shivers: "The dark shadow of the church is dr..."
links.english: The dark shadow of the church is drawn out on the sand... two men stand there. In silence.
links.polish: Mroczny cień kościoła pada na okoliczny piach... Stoi tam dwóch mężczyzn. W milczeniu.
links.belarusian: Цёмны цень касцёла падае на прылеглы пясок... Там стаяць два мужчыны. У маўчанні.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Now -- if it were any other day, I..."
links.english: "Now -- if it were any other day, I would leave for the night. But we have more pressing matters. We need to wrap up this investigation and we need to do it *fast*."
links.polish: „Gdyby to był inny dzień, udałbym się teraz na nocny spoczynek. Ale mamy ważniejsze sprawy na głowie. Musimy zakończyć to śledztwo i to *szybko*”.
links.belarusian: "Калі б гэта быў іншы дзень, я б зараз накіраваўся на начны адпачынак. Але ў нас ёсць больш важныя справы. Мы павінны завяршыць гэтае расследаванне і зрабіць гэта *хутка*".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Well, good, because we *are* partn..."
links.english: "Well, good, because we *are* partners. Now, I have some personal matters I'd like to get in order. If you don't object, I'm going to leave the rest of the day's investigation to you..."
links.polish: „No cóż... To dobrze, bo *jesteśmy* partnerami. Muszę zająć się pewnymi prywatnymi sprawami. Jeśli nie masz nic przeciwko, to do końca dnia pozostawię nasze śledztwo w twoich rękach...”
links.belarusian: "Ну, што ж... Гэта добра, бо *мы* партнёры. Мне трэба заняцца пэўнымі прыватнымі справамі. Калі ты не супраць, то да канца дня пакіну наша расследаванне ў тваіх руках..."

links.title: You: ""Go ahead.""
links.english: "Go ahead."
links.polish: „Dobrze”.
links.belarusian: "Добра".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Try not to break anything while I'..."
links.english: "Try not to break anything while I'm gone. I'll see you in the morning, detective."
links.polish: „Postaraj się niczego nie zepsuć, gdy mnie nie będzie. Zobaczymy się rano, detektywie”.
links.belarusian: "Паспрабуй нічога не сапсаваць, пакуль мяне не будзе. Убачымся раніцай, дэтэктыве."

links.title: Shivers: "The dark shadow of the church is dr..."
links.english: The dark shadow of the church is drawn out on the sand... two men part there. In silence.
links.polish: Mroczny cień kościoła pada na okoliczny piach... Rozstaje się tam dwóch mężczyzn. W milczeniu.
links.belarusian: Цёмная цень касцёла падае на навакольны пясок... Там развітваюцца два мужчыны. Маўкліва.

links.title: You: ""Wait, I wasn't done...""
links.english: "Wait, I wasn't done..."
links.polish: „Poczekaj, jeszcze nie skończyłem...”
links.belarusian: "Пачакай, я яшчэ не скончыў..."

links.title: You: ""That really sucks, man.""
links.english: "That really sucks, man."
links.polish: „Totalnie do dupy, stary...”
links.belarusian: "Зусім дрэнна, стары..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes, it *does*." The lieutenant be..."
links.english: "Yes, it *does*." The lieutenant begins tapping his foot...
links.polish: „Tak, *zgadza się*” – porucznik zaczyna potupywać stopą...
links.belarusian: "Так, *згодны*" — лейтэнант пачынае тупаць нагой...

links.title: Composure: "The lieutenant's not comfortable ta..."
links.english: The lieutenant's not comfortable talking about himself so openly. He's eager to change the subject.
links.polish: Porucznik nie czuje się dobrze, mówiąc tak otwarcie o sobie. Bardzo chętnie zmieni temat.
links.belarusian: Лейтэнант не адчувае сябе добра, кажучы так адкрыта пра сябе. Вельмі ахвотна зменіць тэму.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""In any case, I have some personal..."
links.english: "In any case, I have some personal matters I'd like to get in order. If you don't object, I'm going to leave the rest of the day's investigation to you..."
links.polish: „Tak czy inaczej, muszę zająć się pewnymi prywatnymi sprawami. Jeśli nie masz nic przeciwko, to do końca dnia pozostawię nasze śledztwo w twoich rękach...”
links.belarusian: "Так ці інакш, я мушу заняцца пэўнымі прыватнымі справамі. Калі ты не супраць, то да канца дня пакіну наша расследаванне ў тваіх руках..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I don't suppose anyone ever questi..."
links.english: "I don't suppose anyone ever questions whether you belong here. Whatever your faults, you're a decent-enough detective. No one will ever *doubt* that you're a real Revacholian..."
links.polish: „Nie sądzę, aby ktokolwiek kwestionował kiedykolwiek to, czy powinieneś tu być. Mimo swoich wad jesteś dość przyzwoitym detektywem. Nikt nigdy nie będzie *wątpił* w to, że jesteś prawdziwym revacholczykiem...”
links.belarusian: "Не думаю, што хто-небудзь калі-небудзь паставіць пад сумненне, ці павінен ты быць тут. Нягледзячы на свае недахопы, ты даволі прыстойны дэтэктыў. Ніхто ніколі не будзе *сумнявацца* ў тым, што ты сапраўдны рэвашолец..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I don't suppose anyone ever questi..."
links.english: "I don't suppose anyone ever questions whether you belong here. No matter how badly you fuck up, no matter what a mess you make, you never *stop* being Revacholian..."
links.polish: „Nie sądzę, aby ktokolwiek kwestionował kiedykolwiek to, czy powinieneś tu być. Niezależnie od tego, jak mocno spieprzysz sprawę... Niezależnie od tego, jak wielkiego bajzlu narobisz... Nigdy nie *przestajesz* być revacholczykiem...”
links.belarusian: "Я не думаю, што хто-небудзь калі-небудзь паставіць пад сумнеў тое, ці варта табе тут быць. Незалежна ад таго, наколькі моцна ты сапсуеш справу... Незалежна ад таго, які вялікі хаос ты створыш... Ты ніколі не *перастанеш* быць рэвашольцам..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""... no offence.""
links.english: "... no offence."
links.polish: „...bez urazy”.
links.belarusian: "...без крыўды".

links.title: You: ""None taken.""
links.english: "None taken."
links.polish: „Nie czuję się urażony”.
links.belarusian: "Я не адчуваю сябе пакрыўджаным."

links.title: You: ""I mean, you're not wrong.""
links.english: "I mean, you're not wrong."
links.polish: „No wiesz, masz rację”.
links.belarusian: "Ну ведаеш, ты маеш рацыю".

links.title: You: "Say nothing."
links.english: Say nothing.
links.polish: Nic nie mów.
links.belarusian: Нічога не кажы.

links.title: You: ""My half-brother.""
links.english: "My half-brother."
links.polish: „Swojego przyrodniego brata”.
links.belarusian: "Свайго звязкавага брата".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""That's what you're *supposed* to s..."
links.english: "That's what you're *supposed* to say, of course... But do you know what you *didn't* say?"
links.polish: „To *powinieneś* powiedzieć, oczywiście... Ale wiesz, kogo we mnie *nie* widzisz?”
links.belarusian: "Гэта *ты павінен* сказаць, вядома... Але ці ведаеш ты, каго ўва мне *не* бачыш?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Revacholian.""
links.english: "Revacholian."
links.polish: „Revacholczykiem”.
links.belarusian: "Рэвашольцам".

links.title: You: ""A Seolite.""
links.english: "A Seolite."
links.polish: „Seolitę”.
links.belarusian: "Сеалітэ".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Well, at least you're explicit abo..."
links.english: "Well, at least you're explicit about it. Most of the time people try to be *polite*." The lieutenant doesn't even flinch. "You know what you did *not* say I am, though?"
links.polish: „Cóż... Przynajmniej się z tym nie kryjesz. Ludzie zazwyczaj próbują być *uprzejmi*” – porucznik nawet nie drgnie. „Ale czy wiesz, kogo we mnie *nie* widzisz?”
links.belarusian: "Што ж... Па меншай меры, ты гэтага не хаваеш. Людзі звычайна спрабуюць быць *ветлівымі*", – лейтэнант нават не здрыганецца. "Але ці ведаеш, каго ўва мне *не* бачыш?"

links.title: You: ""Just a... guy.""
links.english: "Just a... guy."
links.polish: „Po prostu... faceta”.
links.belarusian: "Проста... хлопца".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yeah, that's what most people *say..."
links.english: "Yeah, that's what most people *say*. But do you know what they *don't* say?"
links.polish: „Taa... To *mówi* większość ludzi. Ale wiesz, kogo ci ludzie we mnie *nie* widzą?”
links.belarusian: "Та-а... Гэта *кажуць* большасць людзей. Але ведаеш, каго гэтыя людзі ва мне *не* бачаць?"

links.title: You: ""A binoclard.""
links.english: "A binoclard."
links.polish: „Pinglarza”.
links.belarusian: "Пінгларжа".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Be serious a moment, please...""
links.english: "Be serious a moment, please..."
links.polish: „Bądź przez chwilę poważny, proszę...”
links.belarusian: "Будзь хвіліну сур'ёзны, калі ласка..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""People call me all sorts of things..."
links.english: "People call me all sorts of things. But you know the one thing they *never* call me?"
links.polish: „Ludzie nazywają mnie różnie. Ale wiesz, kogo we mnie *nigdy* nie widzą?”
links.belarusian: "Людзі называюць мяне па-рознаму. Але ведаеш, кагосьці ўва мне *ніколі* не бачаць?"

links.title: You: ""A pinball wizard.""
links.english: "A pinball wizard."
links.polish: „Pinballowego czarodzieja”.
links.belarusian: "Пінбольнага чараўніка".

links.title: You: ""I'm not apologizing, if that's wha..."
links.english: "I'm not apologizing, if that's what you're waiting for."
links.polish: „Nie zamierzam przepraszać, jeśli na to czekasz”.
links.belarusian: "Я не збіраюся прасіць прабачэння, калі ты гэтага чакаеш".

links.title: Rhetoric: "What are you, a petulant child? He..."
links.english: What are you, a petulant child? He expects you to apologize.
links.polish: Co ty, nadąsane dziecko jesteś? Oczekuje, że przeprosisz.
links.belarusian: Што ты, надутае дзіця? Чакаю, што ты папросіш прабачэння.
